sources.title: Malta Story
sources.description: Title: Malta Story Summary: In World War II, the island of Malta, strategically located and vital to supply lines in the Mediterranean Sea, is fiercely attacked by the Germans, but staunchly defended by the British. Directed by: Brian Desmond Hurst Actors: Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel Production Company: J. Arthur Rank Organisation Release Date: 5 August 1954 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.66 : 1 In 1942, Britain was clinging to the island of Malta since it was critical to keeping Allied supply lines open. The Axis also wanted it for their own supply lines. Plenty of realistic reenactments and archival combat footage as the British are beseiged and try to fight off the Luftwaffe. Against this background, a Royal Air Force reconnaissance photographer's romance with a local girl is endangered as he tries to plot enemy movements.

metadata.Plot: In 1942, Britain was clinging to the island of Malta since it was critical to keeping Allied supply lines open. The Axis also wanted it for their own supply lines. Plenty of realistic reenactments and archival combat footage as the British are beseiged and try to fight off the Luftwaffe. Against this background, a Royal Air Force reconnaissance photographer's romance with a local girl is endangered as he tries to plot enemy movements.
metadata.Writer: Thorold Dickinson, Peter De Sarigny, Hugh P. Lloyd
metadata.Actors: Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel
